benchmark_details.name: Semantic Routing for Enhanced Performance of LLM-Assisted Intent-Based 5G Core Network Management and Orchestration
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents semantic routing to achieve enhanced performance in LLM-assisted intent-based management and orchestration of 5G core networks. It establishes an end-to-end intent extraction framework and presents a diverse dataset of sample user intents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the performance and reliability of LLM-based intent classification in 5G core networks.

data.source: Dataset of sample user intents generated as part of the research.
data.annotation: Manually crafted prompts and variability adjustments made using LLMs.

methods: Quantitative analysis of intent classification accuracy
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model performance across various experimental setups.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy denotes better performance of the semantic router in classifying intents.
methodology.validation: 5-fold cross-validation used to validate the results.
